imdb.title: Osama Game
imdb.plot: A high school class, containing 32 students, all receive a strange text message on their cell phones one night. It welcomes them to the "Ousama Game," in which they are given specific tasks to carry out in a 24 hour period. No one...

episodes.title: Konran
episodes.plot: Nobuaki begins to tell the story of the King's Game that happened at his old school to his new classmates, who have just witnessed the death of one of their own firsthand. The orders started out simple enough, but quickly escalated.

episodes.title: Kaimei
episodes.plot: Nobuaki, Kenta, and Mizuki leave for the abandoned village where the first King's Game took place. On the trip, Nobuaki tells them what happened when he theorized that King was a member of his old class.

episodes.title: Gokyu
episodes.plot: The death count rises as Nobuaki and his classmates try to find a way out of the game. Can they figure out the meaning of the cryptic newest order before it kills them all?

episodes.title: Eien
episodes.plot: Nobuaki, Kenta, and Mizuki arrive in Yonaki Village to search for clues about the first King's Game.

episodes.title: Ketsudan
episodes.plot: Riona asks Nobuaki to meet her--and shares a secret about Natsuko. Plus, the new day brings with it a new order for everyone in class.

episodes.title: Zenshin
episodes.plot: Nobuaki and Riona are still in last place of the deadly race, with a scheduled punishment coming up--how will they decide who survives?

episodes.title: Shuen
episodes.plot: The survivors of the race barely have any time to catch their breath before the next grotesque order arrives from King. Can Nobuaki and Natsuko put their differences aside to find a way to end the King's Game?
